command: sudo hping3 -c 1 -S -p 45001 target.example && sleep 1 && sudo hping3 -c 1 -A -p 45002 target.example && sleep 1 && sudo hping3 -c 1 -F -p 45003 target.example && ssh -p 22 user@target.example
explanation: Crafts a TCP knock sequence with specific flags (SYN, ACK, FIN) using hping3 to signal a port-unlock workflow on the remote device, then connects via SSH. Requires sudo for raw packet crafting. Detection: alert on hping3 invocation by non-admin users; IDS signatures for low-rate TCP probes with unusual flag combinations to high ports; monitor firewall for transient SSH ALLOW.
rationale_steps: Send crafted TCP packets with specific flags to designated knock ports (requires sudo).
Remote system validates the sequence and modifies rules to allow SSH.
Connect via SSH as soon as the rule opens.
Detect via EDR/IDS monitoring of hping3 usage and flag pattern anomalies to uncommon ports.
